Operation 'CreateMailBatch' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. The current description is comprehensive but lacks explicit clarity about what is returned (MailBatchResponse object) and that no input parameters are required. Added specific return type reference and clarified the no-input requirement for better AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description:
**This operation allows you to generate a new mail batch ID.**

Once a batch ID is created, you can associate it with a mail send by passing
it in the request body of the [Mail Send operation](https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/mail-send/mail-send).
This makes it possible to group multiple requests to the Mail Send operation
by assigning them the same batch ID.

A batch ID that's associated with a mail send can be used to access and modify the associated send. For example, you can pause or cancel a send using its batch ID. See the [Scheduled Sends API](https://www.twilio.com/docs/sendgrid/api-reference/cancel-scheduled-sends) for more information about pausing and cancelling a mail send.
data.description_suggestion: Generates a new mail batch ID for grouping multiple mail send requests. Returns a MailBatchResponse containing the newly created batch ID. The batch ID can be associated with mail sends by including it in the Mail Send operation request body, enabling you to group, pause, or cancel multiple sends together using the batch ID. No input parameters are required.
data.reasoning: The current description is comprehensive but lacks explicit clarity about what is returned (MailBatchResponse object) and that no input parameters are required. Added specific return type reference and clarified the no-input requirement for better AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

message: Operation 'GetMailBatch' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, not_actionable. Original summary 'Validate a batch ID' is passive and doesn't indicate the retrieval action. Description lacks explicit mention of required path parameter and specific response types. Added clarity about what constitutes validity, required inputs, and response schemas for improved AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
**This operation allows you to validate a mail batch ID.**

If you provide a valid batch ID, this operation will return a `200` status code and the batch ID itself.
If you provide an invalid batch ID, you will receive a `400` level status code and an error message.
A batch ID does not need to be assigned to a send to be considered valid. A successful response means only that the batch ID has been created, but it does not indicate that the ID has been assigned to a send.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve and validate a batch ID.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves and validates a mail batch ID by checking if it exists in the system. Requires the batch_id path parameter. Returns a MailBatchResponse with status 200 if the batch ID is valid (exists), or an ErrorResponse with status 400 if invalid. Note: A valid batch ID only confirms creation; it does not indicate whether the batch has been assigned to any mail sends.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Validate a batch ID' is passive and doesn't indicate the retrieval action. Description lacks explicit mention of required path parameter and specific response types. Added clarity about what constitutes validity, required inputs, and response schemas for improved AI agent interpretability.

Current description is vague and primarily references external documentation rather than explaining the operation itself. Missing critical details about request body structure, response behavior, and key features like batch ID support and tracking. Added specific input/output details, supported features, and side effects (queuing for delivery) to enable AI agents to understand when and how to use this operation effectively.

data.current_description:
*The Mail Send operation allows you to send email over SendGrid's v3 Web API*

For an overview of this API, including its features and limitations, please see the [Mail Send API overview page](https://www.twilio.com/docs/sendgrid/api-reference/mail-send)

The overview page also includes links to SendGrid's Email API quickstarts and helper libraries to get you working with this endpoint even faster.
data.description_suggestion: Sends one or more emails via Twilio SendGrid's v3 Mail API. Accepts a request body containing email details (recipients, sender, subject, content, attachments, etc.) and optional batch ID for grouping sends. Supports templates, custom arguments, tracking settings (opens, clicks), and batch scheduling. Returns a 202 Accepted status on success with no response body. Emails are queued for delivery; use batch IDs to track, pause, or cancel sends.
data.reasoning: Current description is vague and primarily references external documentation rather than explaining the operation itself. Missing critical details about request body structure, response behavior, and key features like batch ID support and tracking. Added specific input/output details, supported features, and side effects (queuing for delivery) to enable AI agents to understand when and how to use this operation effectively.
